io
Class SimpleScheduleReader

java.lang.Object
  io.SimpleScheduleReader

public final class SimpleScheduleReader
extends java.lang.Object

A SimpleScheduleReader reads a given .csv file to produce a Schedule. Cells that start with "%" are treated as comments and ignored by the SimpleScheduleReader. Entire lines rows are commented by commenting the first cell in that row. Every row after 2 non-commented lines have been skipped is assumed to represent a Section on a Schedule columns in the following order:

COURSE_ID,SECTION,CLASS_TITLE,INSTRUCTOR,DAYS,START_TIME,END_TIME,CREDITS

Cells that are yet to be determined can be commented, left blank, or contain "TBA". Of the cells, only INSTRUCTOR, DAYS, START_TIME, and END_TIME may be TBA. Input must be read with a read invocation before the Schedule can be retrieved. Multiple Schedules may be read over the lifetime of this instance.

Invariants:
  • none

Version:
May 19, 2011: Class created.
Author:
Jonathan Caddey

read

public void read(java.util.Scanner the_scanner)
Reads input in the format described in the class documentation.

Preconditions:
  • Data has not already been successfully read.
  • the_reader has already read information
Postconditions:
  • none

Parameters:
the_scanner - reads input which has the proper format.

parseCells

protected java.lang.String[] parseCells(java.lang.String the_line)
                                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException
Returns an array containing the Strings that appear from right to left separated by the reader's delimiter. If the ith cell is empty, commented, or TBA, the ith element of the returned array is null. If the last cells are blank they will not be added to the end of the returned array.

Preconditions:
  • the_line != null
Postconditions:
  • The returned array contains the cells of the_line as interpreted as a .csv file.

Parameters:
the_line - a line of cells, separated by this reader's delimiter.
Returns:
the cells represented in the_line, with null for blank or otherwise ignored cells.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if the_line is null.

protected Section parseSectionString(java.lang.String the_line)
